result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew T. Parduhn was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Matthew T. Parduhn is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Matthew T. Parduhn was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
13CF73, 16CM137, and 17CM105 called together. Defendant Matthew T. Parduhn in court, in custody, with attorney Lisa A McDougal. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. Atty McDougal states parties have a global resolution for all cases, including the one case Judge Rood presides over. In 13CF73-withhold sentence and place def on probation for 3 years. 16CM137-Dismiss Count 2, plead to count 1 with 30 day jail consecutive to any sentence he is currently serving. 17CM105-Dismiss Count 2, plead to Count 1 with 60 days in county jail, consectuve to 30 days in 16CM137. 

Court revokes DPA in 13CF73. 16CM137 Count 1, def pleads NC. 17CM105 Count 1, def pleads NC. Findings of guilty. Atty Harper addresses the court on these charges and Judge Rood's case. 

13CF73:
Count1- sentence witheld,3 years probation.
Dismiss count 2.


16CM137:
Count 1- 30 days in county jail, Huber grant. Jail time to begin today. No costs.
Dimiss count 2.


17CM105:
Count 1- 60 days, consecutive to Count 1 in 16CM137. Huber granted. 0 days credit. One set of costs in 17CM105. 

Conditions: Attend, pay for, and succesfully complete any educational programs, obey rules and regulations of probation, one set of costs in 17CM105.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 29, 2017 at 10:00 am.

Motion hearing in 13CF73, plea/sentencing in 16CM137, and initial appearance in 17CM105. Defendant Matthew T. Parduhn in court with attorney Lisa A McDougal. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. DA Harper states the parties are working towards resolution of these matters. Court conducts the initial appearance in 17CM105. NG pleas entered in that case. Counsel request late September date for possible resolution of all matters.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 29, 2017 at 10:00 am.
From RC Jail
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 14, 2017 at 10:00 am.

17CM105, 16CM137, 13CF73 called together. Defendant Matthew T. Parduhn appeared by video means. Atty Lisa McDougal appears telephonically. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. Atty McDougal has not received complaint in new case. Atty McDougal asks for court to address bond. Atty McDougal asks for signature, if not then a low cash bond. State agrees to amend bond to a signature. Court orders a $1000 signature bond, same conditions.  Plea/Sentencing scheduled for August 14, 2017 at 10:00 am.
from RC Jail
